result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawerance A Peters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 8/1/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 8 days jail for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine.

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawerance A Peters

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: letter from Nicole Boehnen
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Lawerance A Peters in court with Attorney Adam J. Schleis.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Schleis makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  FINE:  $479.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid at $50.00 per month, commencing 8/1/16, alternate 8 days jail if not paid)

*Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.*
